Thanx Mark It compiled

However now i am facing a new problem. If i run the=
 same class with the changes it gives me errors

	java.lang.LinkageError: l=
oader constraints violated when linking org/w3c/dom/Document class 	at org.=
custommonkey.xmlunit.XMLUnit.buildDocument(Unknown Source) 	at 	org.customm=
onkey.xmlunit.Diff.<init>(Unknown Source) 	at org.custommonkey.xmlunit.Diff=
.	<init>(Unknown Source) 	at org.custommonkey.xmlunit.XMLTestCase.compareXM=
L(Unknown Source) 	at test_XMLTestCase.testCompareXMLStrings(test_XMLTestCa=
se.java:45) 


And when i run the same class using junit.textui.TestRunner =
it runs smoothly. 
This is amusing. Can u give me some clue as to what is h=
appening.

Regards
Pragnesh

From: Mike Clark [=

"pragnesh.p" wrote:

> Hi,
>
>         I have been asked to do some expl=
oration on JUnit. I have finished exploration of JUnit and JUnitPerf and am=
 currently exploring XmlUnit.
>         There is a funny problem which i am=
 facing currently. When I compile test_XMLTestCase.java (a sample file give=
n) with
>
>     public static void main(String[] args) {
>         (new jun=
it.textui.TestRunner()).run(suite());
>     }
>
> it compiles and runs with=
out any problems.
> However when i do the following change
>
>     public s=
tatic void main(String[] args) {
>         (new junit.swingui.TestRunner())=
.run(suite());
>     }
>
> It gives following error:
>
> test_XMLTestCase.j=
ava:297: cannot resolve symbol
> symbol  : method run  (junit.framework.Tes=
tSuite)
> location: class junit.swingui.TestRunner
>         (new junit.swi=
ngui.TestRunner()).run(suite());
>         ^
> 1 error
>
> Does any one hav=
e an idea of watz happening.
>

The Swing UI's TestRunner uses run(Class te=
st), rather than run(Test test).

Try:

    new junit.swingui.TestRunner().=
run(test_XMLTestCase.class);


Mike
